clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Safety and Effectiveness of TLD Radiofrequency Ablation in the Treatment of COPD
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Single-blind, Sham-controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Targeted Lung Denervation Radiofrequency Ablation Devices in the Treatment of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this trial is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of Targeted Lung Denervation (TLD) for COPD patients using the lung denervation radiofrequency ablation device.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Forced expiratory volume in first second (FEV1) relative to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Defined as change in FEV1 at 6 months relative to baseline in the experimental group, compared to the control group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first moderate or severe COPD exacerbation, first severe COPD exacerbation and first respiratory-related hospitalization.
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as a comparison between study arms of the survival distributions for events based on log-rank tests.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire COPD Version (SGRQ-C) Total score
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as a comparison between study arms of the mean change in SGRQ-C from baseline. The SGRQ-C is a questionnaire developed to measure health status (quality of life) in COPD patients with a total and three component scores for: symptoms, activity and impacts; each score ranges from 0 (no impairment) to 100 (worst possible).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in modified Medical Research Council (mMRC) scale Total score
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as a comparison between study arms of the mean change in mMRC from baseline. The modified Medical Research Council (mMRC) scale is recommended for conducting assessments of dyspnea and disability and functions. Total score ranging 0 to 4. The higher the score, the more deterioration in severity of dyspnea.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in COPD Assessment Test (CAT) Total score
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as a comparison between study arms of the mean change in CAT from baseline. The CAT is a disease-specific HRQL with eight questions; each score ranges from 0 (no impairment) to 5 (worst possible). The CAT has a scoring range of 0-40. Higher scores denote a more severe impact of COPD on a patient's life.
Defined as a comparison between study arms of the mean change in FEV1%pred, FVC(%pred), RV(%pred) from baseline.
Defined as a comparison between study arms of the mean change in 6MWD from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Device Success Rate of experimental group
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of the number of ablation procedures in which the catheter would be successfully placed on the treatment site and the catheter would be successfully withdrawn after the completion of the treatment procedure in all the ablation procedures.

secondary_outcome.measure: (Serious) Adverse Event Rate related to device or procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the total number of events per total number of treatment years.

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with TLD and standard of care (per GOLD guideline).
Patients will undergo sham TLD procedure and be treated with standard of care (per GOLD guideline).

intervention.description: Patients allocated to experimental group will receive TLD therapy during which radiofrequency energy will be delivered to vagus nerve surrounding airway under bronchoscopy.
Patients allocated to control group will receive sham TLD procedure during which catheter will be placed in all treatment locations with no radiofrequency energy delivered.
Patients will also receive standard of care that meet the recommendations of GOLD guideline.
